Title: 14.1 Built-In Function and Operator Reference
14.15 Information Functions
Description: The user name and host name provided by the client

Returns the current MySQL user name and host name as a string
          in the utf8mb3 character set.

Press CTRL+C to copy mysql> SELECT USER();
        -> 'davida@localhost'

The value indicates the user name you specified when
          connecting to the server, and the client host from which you
          connected. The value can be different from that of
          CURRENT_USER().

This function can be used for the default value of a
          VARCHAR or
          TEXT column, as shown in the
          following CREATE TABLE
          statement:
Press CTRL+C to copy CREATE TABLE t (c VARCHAR(288) DEFAULT (USER()));
